summary: The Family Building FEHB Fairness Act mandates that Federal employee health benefit plans cover assisted reproductive treatment. This includes procedures like oocyte/sperm preservation, artificial insemination, in vitro fertilization, genetic testing of embryos, fertility medications, and gamete donation. The Office of Personnel Management, in coordination with the Secretary of Health and Human Services, will determine additional covered treatments. The amendments made by this act shall take effect on the date that is 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act.
